review: Compazine (prochlorperazine):This is not the first time this happened to me, this is just the first time I found out what the drug was called. In the last 10 years I have been to the ER for severe headache and was given something in my IV, every single time within seconds I felt panicked. I have explained this to the ER personel each time but they gave it to me anyway. This time was the worst! I wanted to pull my skin off, scream, leave everything. I couldn't  stay still and my boyfriend watched in horror as I sobbed. He tried to rub my back as comfort and I yelled at him to Please stop touching me and talking (I felt so bad). I truly think I must be allergic to this medicine. When I begged her to reverse it she said she couldn't but some more benadryl which may dull the affects. It didn't work. Now I am scared to death of any medications. It has been 3 months and even now when I think about it I get panicked. So traumatizing

Compazine (prochlorperazine):Awful drug. Was given this as part of a drug cocktail for vomiting that wouldn’t stop. Just a couple minutes after the nurse put it in my IV I felt terror like never before. The worst anxiety I’ve ever felt. Couldn’t be still. Jerky movements. I felt like was coming out of my skin. I literally wanted to rip the IV out and run. My heart rate went up and the nurse was concerned so the dr ended up giving me cogentin, which helped some. It took me days to feel normal again. I now have this on my allergy list. I’m not sure why doctors resort to these cocktails for nausea/vomiting instead of giving zofran. I don’t know why these types of drugs are even still on the market. I understand now why people who suffer from mental illness have a hard time staying on these medications. The side effects are awful.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I wish I'd read all this before allowing this med to be administered last night in the ER for nausea. The hospital didn't have phenergan IV so they went with Compazine. It was given with benadryl and the only warning I got was that it might make me sleepy. It made me sleepy but if I closed my eyes I would forget to breathe and gasp. Like everyone else I felt like I wanted to crawl out of my skin. I cried, pinched myself a lot, can't stop moving, can't get comfortable. I'm praying this leaves my system soon because this is much worse than the anxiety attacks I already suffer from. (Which the doctor who ordered the medicine knew about) This medication should be recalled and discontinued. Add this to your allergy list unless you have no other option

Having taking this medication last night, I went online to see how long it would take to work (I hadn’t even been able to keep down water for 8 hours at this point).  When I searched, it came up with this site and it seems like I’m one of the lucky ones to have not had horrendous side effects.  I was prescribed dissolvable tablets that you put between your lip and gum and within an hour I had finally stopped being sick every few minutes, which was a massive relief.  I didn’t have any negative side effects from the tablets and they did what they were supposed to do.  I’m so sorry for everyone else on here who had such horrendous side effects.  It seems that bad reactions are more common than not, so I’m surprised that the drug is still used.  It seems that most people who reacted badly were given the medication intravenously and mine was oral, so I wonder if that makes a difference to how you react to it.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):Compazine, as listed by a lot of people, is an awful drug. I went into the ER with a headache and nausea, and was given benadryl and compazine via IV in order to quell it. Immediately after the IV went in I started to feel very anxious and have dark thoughts. All I wanted to do was jump out of the hospital bed and run out. Once I was discharged from the hospital the side effects did not go away. I felt like I just wanted to be knocked out to help stop this feeling. I cannot even believe I was able to get sleep that night, but thankfully I did. Even though I got sleep however, it is the next day and I still feel restless and jittery. It is a lot better now, but I do not know how much longer it will last. DO NOT TAKE COMPAZINE!!!!

I went to the ER for a migraine and they gave me this for nausea. Worst experience of my life! I immediately started feeling panicked and restless and my heart rate shot up to 130 even though I was lying down. I ripped out my IV, got up, and paced around, convinced that I would feel like that forever. The nurse came in and told me it was normal and just wrapped me tight in warm blankets so I couldn't move. I couldn't stop shaking and crying until it went away a couple of hours later. Even the Benadryl they gave me as an antidote didn't work. I was wrong in thinking this was a rare side effect! Stay away if you can!

I notice this medication doesn't have very good reviews, and I'm sorry it has not helped more people like it has for myself. For me though it has been a life changer. Prochlorperazine not only helps me tremendously with my nausea and vomiting due to having Ulcerative Colitis but it also helps manage my anxiety and has knocked my migraines down from 5 to 6 times a week to about 2 migraines a month. I hope it continues to work as well as it is. I do not experience any drowsiness from it either. I'm on 10mg 4Xs a day.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I went to the ER for a severe migraine with nausea and stomach pain. I was given an IV cocktail of Toradol, Benedryl, and Compazine. Within 3 minutes of injection, the room went completely black, I thought I was going to faint, a wave of heat overcame my entire body, and my heart rate sky rocketed. I thought I was dying. I had an extreme urge to leave the hospital, I felt that I was not safe, I hit the call button over and over begging for someone to help me. I was extremely restless, my jaw was chattering, I couldn’t stop moving my legs, I felt like I was crawling out of my skin. The nurses had to perform an EKG on my heart as I started having abnormal heart rhythms. After 20 - 30 minutes I was able calm myself down, however, I kept jerking awake with every sound, movement, or voice. I was admitted for observation overnight and hooked up to a heart monitor until I was released. Nurses said these are common side effects after the fact. I will never take compazine again!

This medication works great for nausea and vomiting and it also works great for anxiety induced nausea but I don’t recommend for anyone who has never took an antidepressant or you’ll be writing a bad review like some others.
When given for nausea it causes me to have major panic attacks.
Given this tablets for labyrinthitis melt in your mouth tablets. No side affects. Don't understand why so many are low rating them.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I took a compazine equal called Inapsine. They are practically the same medication. And I had the same reaction every one else did on this site as well. I wanted to rip the IV out of my arm and was pulling my hair out. Bugs felt like they were crawling in my skin. I felt crazy. Because of the Medicine, I developed akathisia and still recovering almost a month later. I do understand that meds work different for everyone, but there’s a reason everyone had the same experience on this. Worst med I’ve ever taken. Never take any Antipsychotic-Antimetic such as compazine, inapsine, and Regalin because they all have the same side effects. They are usually given in migraine cocktails in emergency rooms. Always check what they’re giving you!!! And why they’re giving antipsychotic meds for migraines, I have no idea.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I had a migraine for about 7 days that increased in severity each day. It got so bad I figured my brain tumor was probably growing again so I went to the ER. They gave me compazine and the migraine went away, but within 10 minutes I felt like my heart was going to explode and I wanted to panic really bad, they gave me 2 benadryl which just made me so tired I could barely open my eyes. I had to do a brain MRI and it lasted over 30 minutes. I was just holding in my panic attack the whole time. I went home and went to sleep to wake up to the anxiety still there for the next 3 days!!!!!  It was a terrible experience that I struggled through and found out I am definitely allergic to compazine.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I'm having the same experience as all the other reviewers. I was in hospital for covid and had headache and vomiting. It took care of those things but gave me panic attack and high blood pressure. Dr told me to take Benadryl when I got home, after 75mg it has helped but still hasn't totally countered the effects. I've had compazine before but it wasn't a generic brand. Anyways I won't be taking this anymore.

Very effective for managing nausea. I took it three times a day for two weeks after suffering severe medication induced nausea and found it allowed me to manage food and not constantly feel like I was going to projectile vomit. Don’t be put off by the bad reviews here, everyone is different

So I am pregnant and am experiencing feeling really sick and vomiting in some cases. Was prescribed this medication but I feel it worked for about 10-20 mins then wore off and I was back to feeling sick and over the toilet again. I am on 3mg of it also. I will try it again in the morning see if it’s better. Wish me luck

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I went to the ER after having a migraine for a week straight. The nurse came in and immediately tried to insert compazine into my IV when I stopped her and asked what it was. She told me it was for anti nausea then said  we give this for all migraines and inserted it into my IV before I could even say no. I was fine for 5 minutes until I walked to the bathroom and immediately knew something was wrong. I could barely remember why I had gone in there in the first place and started having extreme anxiety. I have had anxiety attacks before but this was completely different. I started freaking out and telling the doctors that I did not feel right. I felt like I needed to crawl out of my body. I was screaming and freaking out and the doctor was not even phased and responded with yeah this happens sometimes I’ll give you benadryl the feeling didnt go away for days. I took 4 Benadryl a day for sanity.

DO NOT RISK TAKING THIS DRUG. I was administered this medication for a random debilitating headache. For the purpose of describing how bad the following 6 hours were of indescribable extreme agitation resulting from this drug. I must compare it to the following 6 days in hospital (turns out the headache was an acute subarachnoid haemorrhage). I experienced an accidental codeine overdose, three tubes in me including an iv drip, urinary catheter and another draining liquid out of my brain into a bag, severe anxiety triggering not a second of sleep in over 72 hours/subsequent delirium, two code blues, severe constipation/stomach cramps (nothing for 5 days), 1x double enema, a UTI from the catheter and to top it all off a GNO enema administered by two nurses who witnessed me cover myself in my own faeces from uncontrollable shaking whilst giving birth to a rock in a bed pan. If I had a choice of taking a single dose of Stemetil or reliving this week, I would relive the week.

I was given prochlorperazine to help with chemotherapy related nausea and it worked great, no problems at all, but I didn't take it often. Just "as needed" which started out at once a day then became once a week or so as my nausea subsided.Now I keep the drug on hand for when I get what I call "sick-hungry". Sometimes I'll suddenly get nauseous from hunger when a few minutes prior I hadn't thought myself hungry at all. And "sick-hungry" tends to make me not want to do the ONE THING that is needed - which is eat. The prochlorperazine is incredibly helpful for that. It quickly calms the nausea so that I can eat. I'm pretty sure this straddles the line of "off brand usage" but since it works I haven't thought much about that.Side note: I did develop general anxiety from the cancer and chemo that hasn't entirely gone away, but I've never noticed the prochlorperazine affecting my anxiety for better or worse, but that's probably because I don't take it often, maybe once every 2-3 weeks.

I get severe nausea from IBS and anxiety, the only thing that has helped is prochloperazine 5mg! Don't be scared by these reviews, 95% of the bad reviews are talking about IV/injection prochloperazine, which clearly reacts very differently to the much lower pill dose. Within 30 minutes all of my nausea and most of my anxiety disappears, and it doesn't make me sleepy or dizzy either - unless I take more than one pill or take it with other medications that cause drowsiness. I never review medications but I had to show that not everyone has a bad experience with this med.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):Okay so I’ve had a very different experience with the medication given via IV vs orally. I’ve been given Compazine IV for migraines every time I go to the ER for one - it does make me feel like I’m crawling out of my skin and makes my chest burn. BUT I was prescribed it in the oral form for nausea for migraines at home and I didn’t have any issues with it. It does make you sleepy but aside from that there’s nothing compared to how it is via IV.
I was prescribed prochlorperazine for nausea and vomiting during my chemotherapy. It was a life saver. I had no nausea or vomiting at all during and after my infusions.

It's been two years since I had this horrible reaction. I was prescribed prochlorperazine in the form of Stemetil.  I got an injection of stemetil as I was vomiting non-stop and a tablet form to take daily. The first day I felt fine, but it went downhill from there. The next day while I was showering I felt body spasms and general uncomfortable. When I tried to go to bed and sleep, the spasm wouldn't stop. They were all over my body, in my neck, chest, legs, arms. It was very uncomfortable. My mum called an ambulance and they brought me to the ER. By the time I reached the ER I couldn't move any part of my body except my eyes. My body had turned to stone. It was the most frightening thing I have ever experienced. I was very lucky that a nurse on duty had a patient with this before and she knew what to administer. I was given an anti-dote and my body then became normal. I was extremely frightened and afraid to take any further medications. As a result, I have Blepharospasm and botox to mana

I feel terrible for the negative reviewers as their reactions sound awful! This drug has been a miracle for me, will stop a long term migraine and now I have some at home to take when migraines hit. This is after years of no treatment options beyond ibuprofen due to family history of stroke. I am grateful for this drug.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):While on vacation, I went to the  ER with dehydration and nausea, was given IV compazine, and discharged. On the way home, with my husband driving, I began having thoughts of jumping out of the moving car! Once back at our rental house, I began pacing, couldn't sit still for more than a few minutes, felt my heart beating wildly in my chest, had an astronomical BP (which I only have problems with when I am anxious, but I do monitor on a daily basis), and considered jumping off the two-story deck more than once. I've never considered jumping out of a car or hurting myself in any way until receiving this medication. I literally felt as if I was going to come out of my skin due to extreme agitation. Finally, after about 6 hours of this nightmare, the effects began to wear off and I've been okay since. I have no allergies to anything else, but I consider this incident the result of some sort of allergic reaction and now list it as such in my medical history everywhere I go. Proceed with caution!

Compazine (prochlorperazine):The ER doc explained that Compazine should be given with Benadryl to counteract the bad side effects described above. The combination effectively stopped my daughter's migraine in about 20 minutes. We went home and she slept for a few hours and felt a little groggy. That's it!

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I was prescribed this junk after having my gall bladder removed. Long story short I had a SEVERE allergic reaction that caused lock jaw, nausea, and my throat to close. I was on my death bed 2 nights in a row. Literally sucking in as much air as I could as my throat was closing. ER saved my life. Worst meds ever!

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I was given compazine in the ER. I had a headache but I was more concerned about the eye pain and facial spasms. Nurse came in and administered the "migraine cocktail" all at once. It hit me HARD. My body was on fire, and I couldn't stop moving. I asked if it was normal for it to hit people so fast he said yes. He made it seem like I was overreacting though. As soon as he walked out of the room I started seeing flashing stars. Felt as if I was jumping off the bed/convulsing. I kept telling myself to just go to sleep but couldn't. I started crying as silently as I could because I was scared and embarrassed. I eventually fell asleep for a half hour. Woke up to them talking to me. I was still shaking and mentally out of it. Discharge felt like an eternity. I went home and slept forever. The day lingered and I experienced a worse headache, muscle spasms, locked wrist, and an auditory hallucination. It is day three and I still feel weird. I wish they could have warned me of side effects.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I work in a hospital, suffered from migraines for years and I have never heard of compazine until a couple of days ago when I went to the ER after work, I was thinking of just getting to Toradol shot but they suggested the IV Migraine Margarita I asked for the side effects of the new drug they put in my IV they said oh just normal side effects of any drug literally a few seconds later I was pulling my hair out, couldn’t be on my phone, was crying and screaming, pressing my call light button 500 times begging the nurse to just take the IV out, they wouldn’t. I was shaking uncontrollably, kicking literally out of my control! I just wanted to leave, I just wanted to run away what seemed like my own body. Worst experience of my life. I am now scared to go to the ER, I am now scared to get my migraines figured out. This drug is extremely dangerous, needs to be banned. Definitely a PTSD experience. I’m so sorry for whoever else went through it. I thought I was the only one!

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I’ve had this medication given twice, both for severe migraines! It was part of the migraine cocktail, and when it was pushed the first time, I had a feeling of impending doom flush over me…I felt like I couldn’t breath and that my anxiety was out of control.  Second time, I told the doctor not to give it to me, but I guess they still ordered it anyway.  Ended up pushing it again and it was way worse than the first time.  I felt like I disconnected from reality, I became anxious and paced to the bathroom and back.  Just the worst impending doom over my head. I told the nurse to give me more Benadryl to reverse these horrid side effects. It worked but that same feeling lingered on to the next day. Just blurred vision, anxiety and was jittery. It’s now the third day, and I feel a lot better. Took 50 mg of Benadryl the night before and I think that helped. Don’t recommend it to anyone.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I have severe migraines all the time. Since I was 11 and I'm 51 now and they have gotten a lot worse with nausea and vomiting, nose bleeds. I had one last night so bad I just couldn't take it anymore. I had my daughter drive me to the ER. I waited for an eternity to get in a room to lay down  but when. I finally did and saw a dr they gave me 2 shots in my IV. 10 minutes later I was out. I was woken up by the nurse and my headache was gone! I had no side effects to this at all. It's great to finally have something to help after suffering with these stupid migraines all these years.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):Someone said they were in a state of psychosis and that really sums it up how I was on this. I was given this drug in the ER and 15 minutes later I couldn't sit still, I felt like I wanted to rip my skin off and pull my hair out. I wanted to scream and felt like I was on the edge of a complete meltdown. When I got home I tried to take a hot shower and I took a vicodin hoping it would calm me, took benadryl after hoping to just sleep. It was the worst night I've ever lived thru. I kept having urges to jump out of a window or run in traffic. I was desperate for the agony to end. Now I say I'm allergic and refuse to let my children have this medication.  They need to pull it.

I take one or two 5mg tablets when I feel sick from my IBS and within 45 mins I feel so much better! The only side effects I get is sometimes a bit dizzy/blurry vision but it beats constantly feeling like I'm going to throw up.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I went to the ER for nausea and a horrible migraine after a week of being COVID positive. The Dr gave me the migraine cocktail  Benadryl and Compazine. After about 5min my migraine was gone but I was shaking, sweating, I unplugged my BP cuff and wanted to unhook my IV. My body was uncontrollably moving and my vision was impaired. The room get like it was spinning and closing in. I urge you to be cautious when approving this cocktail to be pushed through your IV. I will never allow this to be given to me again. I thought I was going to DIE. It was an awful experience and I had just gotten over covid.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I'd been put on amitriptyline for migraine prevention and it only caused more so the emergency room would give me Benadryl and compazine. It didn't help. At first I would have a laughing fit over nothing and then only rage would set in. I don't mean angry, I'm talking a blind rage that I'm surprised anyone would let me walk out of the hospital with. It was horrible.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):Scariest medicine in the world, was gave compazine yesterday night when I was admitted in the hospital, doc gave it to me for nausea and anxiety. Made it worse! I had suicidal thoughts, wanted to check myself out of the hospital but couldn’t cause was loosing so much blood, my legs and arms are restless even a day after. I’m so mad I was given this drug after seeing all these reviews and all the same side affects so sad

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I had this as part of the migraine cocktail via injection in the ER and my god I finally got relief after a two day horrific migraine! They then gave it to me in pill form to take home and I made the mistake of reading reviews and scared myself out of taking them! Finally one day a migraine did me in so I tried the compazine and it helped. I've now taken it at least two dozen times and have no side effects. It's supposed to stop a migraine from escalating. I don't find it works for nausea.Recently my daughter had a severe migraine and I took her to the ER and they gave this to her in an IV and within minutes I watched her heart rate shoot to 117. I rang the nurse who told us that it's a strong rush of meds into the system and if it's something you aren't used to, it can make you panic. This actually calmed her and her heart rate slowly dropped to the 70s and she slept for a few hours. She woke up feeling better. She's also now taken this in pill form and has had no reaction.

In australia we call this Stemetil. I presented to emergency with dizziness, nausea, and just feeling off. Was given a dose of stemetil through IV and the effect was instant! I had a panic attack and managed to calm down. They discharged me an hour later. I went home, and I could not control my body, my muscles were spasming like crazy and I was shaking! Called an ambulance and they took me to ED and was given benztropine. That worked for 2 hours. I woke up and still the same, intense muscle spasms and shaking. It took 6 months for me to recover from that one dose of stemetil. I am so glad it was not permanent as I couldn't imagine living life like that. I also developed a condition called POTS and was unable to stand for more than a minute without my heart racing. This also lasted 6 months. DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG!! I even read on the list of side effects that dystonia can be permanent from this drug! Don't risk it!!

I absolutely LOVE this medicine, it has helped me w/medicated nausea for 2 years, I only take it when I'm feeling nausea, nothing works better or faster then this. It also keeps me very calm. Love it!

It makes me a bit relieved that I'm not alone. I went to the ER for a migraine as many of you have, literally a minute after I was giving compazine, I felt, firstly  burning in my IV and secondly, I had to be restrained to the bed because of the anxiety I was feeling. I would rather suffer my hemiplegic migraine and my cluster headaches on my on than to ever have this again. It's so bad I have anxiety going to the ER now. It's been 7 days and I still do not feel any better, I have random attacks remembering how I felt that day and now I feel like I am losing my mind.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I went to the ED July 10 2021 for feeling dizzy and nauseous (come to find out I had fluid behind my left ear). Anywho they gave me compazine and Benadryl. . . Let me just say I felt worse leaving the hospital then going in. My dizziness and nauseous went away but I left the hospital feeling like a psych person. My body couldn't stop moving but at the same time I was extremely tired. I couldn't even drive home. This drug she definitely be off the market. It took a little over 14 hours to get out my system

Compazine (prochlorperazine):Was given compazine with benadryl in the ER for a severe migraine that was preceded by an aura, and included light, sound, and smell sensitivity. As well as nausea and vomiting. I suffer from chronic migraines, and have since I was a little girl, (cis gendered), I remember my first grade teacher laying me under her desk and putting her coat over my eyes to help, while waiting for my mom. My biological mom, (who was diagnosed with a brain CCM ), also has chronic migraines, as did her biological father.  Once given the compazine, I became anxious, agitated, couldn't hold still,  wanted to crawl out of my skin! My then SO had to beg the nurses to call in the doctor to do something, I was about to tear out the IV drip and run! They finally gave me some ativan and I calmed down. Shift change happened and my new nurse said she's seen it happen a few times before and she doesn't like the compazine/benadryl for migraines.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I went to the ER yesterday for a migraine and nausea that I was experiencing for 5 days. They gave me a cocktail of torodal, Benadryl, Tylenol and Compazine. 1 day later I am still having horrible panic attacks and my arms feel like they are non-stop moving. It feels as if I have restless leg syndrome in my arms. This medication made me feel like I was dying. I had to stay home from class and work because I couldn't function. I hope this arm sensation goes away soon.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I was given compazine along with tramadol via IV at the ER to help treat a bad migraine. As soon as they put it in my IV I wanted to rip it out and leave. My mom was with me and I stayed a few more hours until my bloodwork came back. I finally got discharged and just wanted to go home and sleep but of course I couldn’t. I was jittery and shaky. I was pacing back and forth in my room. I couldn’t sit still. I can’t find the words to describe exactly what I felt but I basically felt so uncomfortable and like I was going insane at the same time. I went back and they gave me a Benadryl which did absolutely nothing. Luckily my mom had some left over lorazepam which finally gave me some relief and allowed me to sleep. It took 2 days for the worst of it to wear off but now 6 days later I still don’t feel 100% back to normal yet. I will never take this medication ever again and I hope it gets taken off the market soon. I hope no one else ever has to experience what I did.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):Goodness me I went for extreme abdominal pain and nausea with vomiting and was given this since Zofran did not work at home prior to my arrival. I was already somewhat concerned as my partner had been given compazine as part of a migraine cocktail and had the worst panic attack of their life. They administered it to them right into the arm however and mine was being put thru the IV saline bag as a slow drip so I wasn't that worried; I figured it would infuse slow enough it wouldn't bother me. Boy was I wrong. About 5-10 minutes later I was so warm and overheated, my hands went numb as I began to panic for what seemed like no reason. I was full on shaking and hyperventilating as well as feeling trapped and somehow more nauseated than before. The initial panic lasted maybe 15 minutes but I felt on edge for the rest of the day and like I was still fighting off a panic attack.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I was given this for a migraine storm, and it made me cry pull out my IV. All I wanted was my husband and they would not let him back in. I am still extremely nervous. This stuff should be outlawed.

I went to the er for an ear problem and they diagnosed me with a migraine which I kept telling them I didn’t have but they didn’t listen they gave me this drug with some Benadryl and I will never take it again I already had anxiety and I was finally not having the panic attacks anymore and after this drug my anxiety came back I just wanted out of the hospital I felt like a zombie if I got up to walk the effort it took to walk was the worst feeling ever it’s been 18 hours since I took it and I’m still not sitting still or breathing correctly after I left the hospital I could not sleep I kept fighting it my heart rate was sky rocketed for over 6 hours and thought I was just gonna collapse anytime I hope this wears off soon because I can’t keep feeling like this.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I went to the ER the other day for the worst headache I had ever had in my whole life and they gave me compazine along with some other things, and I immediately couldn’t breath. I sat up coughing, feeling like I had to throw up but unable to. My whole body felt numb and I kept seeing spots of black. Everything was moving in slow motion. There were too many people around me.My side effects went away after about 8 hours (probably because they gave me so many fluid bags, probably like 6 that I peed three times the most I ever had in my entire life). But yeah, my heart rate hit 153 and then they tried to do an EKG on me because they thought that an otherwise healthy 18 year old was having a heart attack. Not once during this time did my heart rate fall below 100. According to their notes it was 124 when I left.I will not be letting someone put this in my body ever again, because while I am not having anymore full blown panic attacks the anxiety is still high within me.

There’s so many bad reviews, if I had seen these before being given these tablets I would have never taken them! But my experience has been good. I have been taking 5mg on and off for dizziness and nausea for the past 7 years. They work well for my nausea, and sometimes take the edge off of my lightheadedness. They make me a little sleepy sometimes but other than that, no side effects at all.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I went to the ER for a severe atypical migraine. They gave me Compazine via my IV along with Benadryl to prevent a side effect. After receiving it I have never been so restless in my life. I couldn’t stop moving and squirming. My husband thought I was going mad. It did help when they gave me additional Benadryl but I still couldn’t sit still or sleep. I felt like ripping my IV out. It was like I was a fish out of water flipping around. I had to get an MRI and I wasn’t able to sit still for that so they did give me Ativan which eventually helped some more by knocking me out, but I still felt uneasy before it put me to sleep and when I woke up as well. It’s now been two days almost 3, and I’m still feeling like I can’t relax or sit still which is making it hard to sit at work. I will never take this again and am having it added to my chart as an adverse/allergic reaction
This drug is horrible. It did a number on me couldn't sleep, eat, made my feel crazy. I'm glad I recovered from this. Just horrible!!! This medication should be off the market.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I was prescribed this medication after vomiting for days on end and becoming dehydrated. (It was later found that I had a bad case of reflux which was being aggravated by my birth control.) After an IV of fluids to hydrate me the ER doctor sent me home with Compazine. Compazine (prochlorperazine):They gave me this medication via IV in the ER for a very intense migraine and extreme nausea, I would never recommend this medication to anyone ever, the second it was pushed through, I started having an extreme panic attack, something like I have never felt before, like a huge wave of doom rushed over me, I started freaking out so badly I almost ripped my IV out and ran away, it was so traumatizing to me that they pushed a big dose of Ativan though my IV just to knock me out, I truly thought I was dying... Compazine (prochlorperazine):I had been suffering from severe nausea and vomiting on and off including migraine, fever and flank pain. On a early Sunday morning about 4am had dizziness then could not get out of bed for about 2 hours zero gravity. After day times was not to bad but like being drunk. Compazine (prochlorperazine):Had a severe allergic reaction to compazine which was given to me to treat nausea,  unable to breathe, throat closed had to be rushed to hospital. and it didn't stop the vomiting

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I've been taking Compazine for years for nausea due to stomach problems. I have never had any side effects and it completely gets rid of my nausea. Best antiemetic for me.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):If i could rate this lower than a 1 I would. Worst. Experience. Of my life. This is an amazing drug for nausea, this gives me no side effects and takes the feeling of nausea away amazingly.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):Had nausea from chemo and radiation and was given Zofran. Zofran did nothing to curb the nausea. I was just recently changed over to Compazine and the nausea is gone! I've not experienced any side effects whatsoever.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I was in the hospital suffering from post lumbar puncture headache and nausea/severe vomiting. Compazine (prochlorperazine):I experienced the "restlesss, anxious" side effects from this medication and it's been almost 24 hours and I am still feeling it in my legs.  My headache is gone which is great, but my legs can't stop moving.
Compazine (prochlorperazine):I used it for sometime and it caused me temporary muscular spasms in my face. I prefer Zofran.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):This medication does help out a lot when you have nausea. Compazine (prochlorperazine):I was always tired and lethargic. I thought it was from the chemo I was taking but when I switched to Anzemet, I realized it was the Compazine that made me tired.
I was injected (IV) during shoulder(rotator)surgery. I was expecting to deal with nausea as in a past procedure. Absolutely no problems, this one is a keeper!

Compazine (prochlorperazine):I am an older adult in good health.  I originally had dizziness (possibly from a virus or sinus bug)  which caused nausea.  This medication took away both symptoms within 1-2 hours and I was able to carry on with my normal activities.

Compazine (prochlorperazine):This medicine is absolutely wonderful. I had a stomach virus, took this medicine and did not vomit or feel nauseated again. I would recommend this to anyone suffering a stomach virus.

This stuff works really well. I never imagined that there was a pill that could make you stop vomiting.  When I was very sick yesterday and could non stop throwing up, I took this and it stopped completely.  Two thumbs up.

I had extreme nausea from an assumed stomach virus, and while I still had some nausea, I felt better and it took away the feeling of having to vomit. So minus some diarrhea associated with that stomach bug, I didn't have any vomiting and my nausea eased up.
